googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Minnesota voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: If you have a Minnesota driver's license, state ID card, or the last 4 numbers of your social security -- and an email address -- you can register to vote online. If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Minnesota driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Minnesota you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Minnesota for 20 days before the next election
  * maintain residence at the address given on the registration form
  * be at least 18 years old on Election Day
  * if previously convicted of a felony, have completed or been discharged from your sentence
  * not be under a courtordered guardianship in which the right to vote has been revoked
  * not be found by a court to be legally incompetent to vote
